programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1999, Texas was terrorized by a brutal serial killer who traveled by train. The FBI assembled a task force to gather information about the dangerous drifter and create a profile that would help locate him. As they learned that the killer had traveled extensively through the United States and Mexico, the murders became more frequent, and authorities had to cast a dragnet over an entire continent in an effort to catch him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Yaser Said breaks his silence about the night he fatally shot his teenage daughters near Dallas, Texas, the events leading up to the tragedy, and how he managed to evade capture for over a decade.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: A gruesome video on a stolen SD card exposes Brian Steven Smith's secret double life; David Scott confronts this soft-spoken husband and serial killer about his nighttime hunts for vulnerable Alaskan women.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On December 21, 1998, two gunmen kidnap three janitors on their way to clean the Bank of America ATM repository in Las Vegas. The gunmen force the janitors to let them in the ATM repository and hold them hostage until the armored car guards arrive to make their nightly collection. When the guards enter the bank, the gunmen surprise them and shoot one guard in the chest before escaping with $1,088,000, the largest bank robbery take in Las Vegas history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1992, a man returned to his Memphis home and discovered that his wife was missing. The husband, as well as his friends, family and neighbors began to receive ransom calls. FBI agents noticed that one neighbor seemed to have the best rapport with the kidnapper. They began to question his level of involvement, but had to proceed carefully, knowing that he could be their only link to the missing woman.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Emotions ran high in the days following the Nov. 11, 2001 attack on the U.S.; for the most part, the grief and anger brought people together but for Frank Roque, it was a motivation for killing an innocent immigrant chasing the American dream.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The animal kingdom is full of deadly predators, and some of them attack in extraordinary and inexplicable ways; some animals strike back at humans for reasons beyond normal defense and hunger.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Despite all of our modern technology and sophistication, there is much that we still don't know about what lies beneath our feet, deep underground.

programme.desc: From ancient civilizations to 20th century empires, mankind has had an inexplicable fascination with preserving the dead. But why?

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What gives animals extraordinary powers? We like to think of ourselves as the peak of evolution--but what if we're wrong?

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: There's a growing phenomenon of alleged UFO sightings known as Orbs. Witnesses who see the Orbs also report having dreams, premonitions, and a deep fear.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: They are described by hundreds of witnesses as grey-skinned beings: no ears, no nose and bulbous black eyes. Are these so called "Greys" visitors from another planet? The team investigates stories of abductions in two different countries.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: It has long been suspected that Nazi leaders had more than a passing interesting in the occult and UFOs. UFO investigators now believe there was a connection between the UFO phenomenon and the Third Reich.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Area 51 is considered the ultimate top secret facility, one that UFO investigators believe houses an extraterrestrial secret. But is there an even more secretive facility? In Dugway, UT, there is a remote testing facility sometimes referred to as Area 52.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: From microscopic particles, to large pieces of unknown metal--UFO "trace cases" offer some of the most convincing evidence that UFOs may have been visiting earth for centuries.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On October 26, 1994, the U.S. government made their first official acknowledgement of Area 51. Six months later, nearly 4,000 acres of previously public land surrounding the base were closed.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On April 19, 1897, the Dallas Morning News reported a mysterious airship had crashed into a windmill in the nearby town of Aurora, Texas. Townspeople were said to have found an alien body and buried it in the local graveyard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Two couples found themselves on the same deserted island paradise. But only one couple left alive. Buck Walker and Stephanie Stearns arrived in Hawaii on the Sea Wind, which belonged to the missing couple, Mac and Muff Graham. Buck and Stephanie were arrested and served time for boat theft. But years later, bones were discovered on the deserted island and identified as the remains of Muff Graham.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He wandered the streets of New York City wearing only pajamas and a bathrobe, but the FBI was convinced that Vince Gigante, the reputed boss of the Genovese crime family, was anything but crazy. The FBI used undercover surveillance, secret audio tapes, six mobsters turned government informants and the testimony of twelve FBI agents to help convict Gigante of murder and conspiracy-to-murder, including a plot to kill rival mob boss John Gotti.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He was a recluse who spread terror through the mail for 18 years. Two men died and more than a dozen were injured, but Ted Kaczynski wasn't known as the Unabomber until his brother tipped off the FBI. Kaczynski's “Unabomber Manifesto,” published in major newspapers, set off a flurry of activity for the FBI: writing analysis and comparisons, DNA gleaned from a single postage stamp and finally, Kaczynski's arrest at his tiny cabin.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Racial tensions in Buffalo in 1980 were at an all-time high. Six black males had been brutally murdered--two had their hearts cut out. The only thing connecting the victims was their ethnicity and the fact that each had been shot with .22 caliber bullets. Residents screamed for the police to stop this serial killer. With no suspects, local investigators turned to the FBI. Profilers were able to produce a psychological composite of the type of person the killer would most likely be. Their analysis paid off.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.desc: Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.title: How India’s Narendra Modi Took Power
programme.desc: Narendra Modi, India’s prime minister, is both highly popular and deeply polarizing. How did he get to the top of Indian politics, and what do his policies mean for the country’s future?

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek
programme.desc: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring together the latest news from the world of business and finance and the interesting stories of global technology, politics, economics and more by harnessing the power of Bloomberg Businessweek reporters and editors.

programme.title: The Future with Hannah Fry:Super Intelligence
programme.desc: Do you want to know what your future holds? A life beyond 150 years old? A world where computers can read our emotions? A planet transformed by unlimited clean energy? Mathematician Hannah Fry will explore these questions and more.

programme.title: Hurricanes of 2024 with Bryan Norcross
programme.desc: FOX Weather Hurricane Specialist Bryan Norcross looks back at the 2024 hurricane season examining the forecast compared to how the season unfolded and breaking down the devastating storms that impacted millions.

programme.title: Eyes In The Storm
programme.desc: FOX Weather Exclusive Storm Tracker, Mark Sudduth's network of cameras takes viewers into the ferocity of Earth's most vicious hurricanes. For years Sudduth has put his 'Eyes in the Storm.' Now, he's sharing the journey and passion behind his work. Sudduth is joined by FOX Weather's Bryan Norcross, Britta Merwin, and Ian Oliver, in telling his unique story of documenting these killer cyclones.

programme.title: Crypto Crash

programme.title: Stranded At The Border
programme.desc: In Real Life shows the reality at the U.S.-Mexico border, where people are living in dangerously poor conditions while seeking asylum.

programme.title: The Slavemaster
programme.desc: A father, husband and businessman by day transforms into a sadomasochistic by night. This veteran con-man lures unsuspecting women with a web of lies and empty promises only to trap them in a world of sex slavery and murder.

programme.title: An Opportunity To Kill
programme.desc: A wayward ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, off everyone's radar. He's homeless and forgotten about, committing petty crimes here and there, until one day he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: 7 Action News Streaming
programme.desc: WXYZ 7 Action News is Detroit's breaking news and weather leader. Channel 7 - on-air, online at WXYZ.com and always Taking Action for You.

programme.title: Doctor Death
programme.desc: For more than a decade, a genius doctor with a homicidal hobby gets away with murder at hospitals across two continents. Cops race against incredible odds to track him down just before he takes his next job and kills…again.

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Fit To Kill
programme.desc: A beautiful brunette is killed and left inside a burned out luxury car in the high desert. At first, it seems as though the perpetrators have gotten away with murder. As cops investigate the brutal homicide, they find a trail of missteps, which they trace back to two muscle-bound, married murderers.

programme.title: 7 Action News at 6PM

programme.title: Positively Detroit
programme.desc: We're taking a look at all the good things happening around Metro Detroit.

programme.title: Operation Black Coral: Intercepting Caribbean Coke
programme.desc: Sarasota detective, Jim Sweeting, infiltrates the vicious Cuban cocaine pipeline controlled by the Medellin cartel. The agent re-invents himself and takes on an alias of a drug trafficker to collect evidence and break the back of the source. Along the way Sweeting enters a violent drugs and money world guided only by his wits and a trusted confidential informant. To bust the dealers and stay alive he must put in the performance of a lifetime or be exposed, and killed.

programme.title: 7 Action News Streaming
programme.desc: WXYZ 7 Action News is Detroit's breaking news and weather leader. Channel 7 - on-air, online at WXYZ.com and always Taking Action for You.

programme.title: Operation Wake Up Cafe: Illegal Betting In Jersey
programme.desc: Passaic County, New Jersey officer Julia Torres goes undercover to bust an illegal betting club entrenched in the Little Italy neighborhood. As a woman running the operation dominated by male wise guys, it's a constant juggling act to collect evidence while not being made as a cop. Along the way, Torres life-saving efforts on a small boy nearly expose her and the operation. She manages to record conversations and bring down the backroom gambling operation to the delight of neighbors who applaud her efforts.

programme.title: Next Gen Stunts
programme.desc: Powering Hollywood's flashiest films behind the scenes, stunt workers push for better - and safer - working conditions.

programme.title: RV Living

programme.title: Crypto Crash
programme.desc: What was behind the collapse of crypto giant FTX? And what does it say about digital currencies, celebrity endorsements, and the collision of tech and finance?

programme.title: Stranded At The Border
programme.desc: In Real Life shows the reality at the U.S.-Mexico border, where people are living in dangerously poor conditions while seeking asylum.

programme.title: The Slavemaster
programme.desc: A father, husband and businessman by day transforms into a sadomasochistic by night. This veteran con-man lures unsuspecting women with a web of lies and empty promises only to trap them in a world of sex slavery and murder.

programme.title: An Opportunity To Kill
programme.desc: A wayward ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, off everyone's radar. He's homeless and forgotten about, committing petty crimes here and there, until one day he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: A Treacherous Triangle
programme.desc: Two prominent doctors, two towns apart, are entangled in a passionate rivalry for the same woman's affections. When one loses, he exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a friend to take out the opposition.

programme.title: Doctor Death
programme.desc: For more than a decade, a genius doctor with a homicidal hobby gets away with murder at hospitals across two continents. Cops race against incredible odds to track him down just before he takes his next job and kills…again.

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Fit To Kill
programme.desc: A beautiful brunette is killed and left inside a burned out luxury car in the high desert. At first, it seems as though the perpetrators have gotten away with murder. As cops investigate the brutal homicide, they find a trail of missteps, which they trace back to two muscle-bound, married murderers.

programme.title: Redneck Retribution
programme.desc: A scorned mistress exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a group of derelicts to kill the wife of her lover. When the heat comes, she plays the victim and denies any involvement, but no level of acting will allow her to escape the cold truth, the murder was caught on camera.

programme.title: News 3 at 6:30
programme.desc: WTKR News 3 in Hampton Roads - The latest local and national news and local weather, traffic and sports.

programme.title: Operation Pisces: Money Laundering For The Medellin Cartel
programme.desc: DEA Agent JD Miller is laundering money for the Medellin cartel. He needs help with the sheer volume of cash pickups so he brings in veteran undercover operative Louis Diaz to manage the West Coast operations. Together, JD and Louis run a scheme that also funds the DEA's evidence building efforts against Colombian kingpin, Jose Lopez. When they have enough recorded conversations and seized evidence against the kingpin, they take down Lopez and unearth his sprawling criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Operation Black Coral: Intercepting Caribbean Coke
programme.desc: Sarasota detective, Jim Sweeting, infiltrates the vicious Cuban cocaine pipeline controlled by the Medellin cartel. The agent re-invents himself and takes on an alias of a drug trafficker to collect evidence and break the back of the source. Along the way Sweeting enters a violent drugs and money world guided only by his wits and a trusted confidential informant. To bust the dealers and stay alive he must put in the performance of a lifetime or be exposed, and killed.

programme.title: Operation Dead Ringer: Busting Escobar's Cartel
programme.desc: Bill Gately and the U.S. Customs Service discover the owner of a coin laundry is laundering large sums of cash through a bank that originates from Columbia. Gately learns that one of the sources of the cash is none other than Pablo Escobar. Gately goes undercover and uses the man as a Trojan Horse to purchase one ton of cocaine, and follows the drugs to its destination. Along the way, the FBI bullies into the operation and loses the coke. Gately pulls out the stops to save his case and arrest those involved.

programme.title: Operation Wake Up Cafe: Illegal Betting In Jersey
programme.desc: Passaic County, New Jersey officer Julia Torres goes undercover to bust an illegal betting club entrenched in the Little Italy neighborhood. As a woman running the operation dominated by male wise guys, it's a constant juggling act to collect evidence while not being made as a cop. Along the way, Torres life-saving efforts on a small boy nearly expose her and the operation. She manages to record conversations and bring down the backroom gambling operation to the delight of neighbors who applaud her efforts.

programme.title: Next Gen Stunts
programme.desc: Powering Hollywood's flashiest films behind the scenes, stunt workers push for better - and safer - working conditions.

programme.desc: The nomadic life of RV communities is, for some, an escape - for others, it's a necessity.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Drink a local beer as you browse antiques and oddities. Donate to a good cause by sticking a dollar bill in the ceiling at a popular tavern, and get your recommended eight to fourteen hours of sleep in a vintage camper.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Snoballs, hatchet throwing, jazz and more on two cheap dates in New Orleans.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Join Esquire’s Dave Holmes as he chats with pop superstar, Zara Larsson, covering all things music, food, and Dave's can't-miss hot spots in Kansas City.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Florence born Chef Simone Montali, Academic Supervisor of the CSCA sets out to school Executive Chef Anthony Haley of Antonios Bacari in Hyde Park with his Tuscan flavors. Will Chef Simone prevail or will Chef Anthony have his own lesson to teach?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Life is all about the friendships we make. These bonds inspire us, drive us, support us, and can even save lives. In this episode, we explore special friendships across the country doing just that.

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet one of Massachusetts hockey’s native sons: Charlie Coyle. From Weymouth to Boston University all the way to the NHL, Coyle is one of the great sports stories of grit and grace.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From ice hockey to lacrosse to tennis, Baltimore coaches help drive the next generation to find family, inspiration and pride through sports.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel suits up with Radio DJ and fashionista Tiara LaNiece. They grab one-of-a-kind threads you can only find in Charm City, dance with the city's best hip hop crew, stop for some sweet treats and create an incredible graffiti mural.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Green Bay Packers Hall of Famer Gilbert Brown shows Greg his go-to spots in Milwaukee. They visit his favorite barbershop, meet Hall of Famer, Leroy Butler, try a legendary burger, and surprise a high school football team for an inspiring practice.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From paying ransoms to scouring hand-drawn treasure maps, these theft victims will do anything to recover their precious property.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: FIXT: Veteran Faces Terrifying Decision
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From cycling on a party boat to practicing yoga in the great outdoors, Rob discovers that Boston’s newest neighborhood is full of surprises.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Young, single, and new to Sacramento, Aurora knows what she wants and goes after it. Three Sacramento bachelors will try to win her over with a day of tango lessons, wood working and a jam session.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: All across this country, people are stepping up to help their communities in big and small ways. From nurses, veterans and firefighters, to teachers, neighbors, and strangers, every community has a hero.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A missing Milwaukee woman's family and her community push for answers about her disappearance. What authorities learn a week later sends shockwaves through the city.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Emily Larsen and Isaac Barreto are tossing the animal products aside in today's Vegan Victors challenge. Will the chefs pull off cooking an entirely plant-based meal to perfection? Or will they end up missing their meat, dairy and eggs?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1977, people across Pittsburgh live in fear as a string of brutal killings sends detectives on a chase to catch the shotgun slayer. He invades homes and senselessly attacks with a shotgun, knives and hammers in the dead of night.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob hits up a new wine tasting spot, gets a butt contouring treatment, knocks down some pins and then hits the ice at Warrior Ice Arena.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find crazy beer concoctions with local ingredients, mini cheesecake flights, and bronze sculptures that call for change? The same place where a quirky sign museum lights the path down memory lane and riverboats rule the waterways.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Host Frank Nicotero visits "The Big Easy" armed with trivia questions about the unbelievable things people have seen in a bottle, under a church floorboard and even inside a mail truck!

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Local comedy duos debate the best po' boys in the city, get fit and flexible, discover vintage threads and more on two cheap "dates" in New Orleans.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From an officer whose historic service is finally recognized, to a literary pioneer discovered right next door, every place has a hidden history. These are the unsung heroes, uncovered places, and untold connections in communities across this country.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: KISS-FM radio host, Alley Faith joins Greg to explore places that put Milwaukee on the map. They visit the Harley Davidson Museum, a unique cheese creamery and ring the bell with Mayor Cavalier Johnson atop what was once the world's tallest building.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel gears up for a day of nonstop action with adrenaline-junkie and restaurateur, Steve Chu. They get their hearts pumping with crazy-fast jet skis, hardcore jiu jitsu training, a sky-high ropes course and an epic paintball showdown.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: In this battle, it’s a head chef showdown. Chef Brandon Basista of Bearded Chef food truck faces off with Chef Alex Diaz of Alex’s Fresh Kitchen in Casselberry. It's a battle of the beards on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Dr. Treva Brown holds a PhD in Chemistry, works for the US Naval Research Laboratory and is a pageant queen. This workaholic PhDiva can’t make time for herself! Kinga wants to take Treva off the runway and into the outdoors.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Single father Kendal Fenwick is the 295th homicide in Baltimore in 2015. Family and investigators wonder whether his efforts to curb drugs and violence in his neighborhood made him a target. Or is it something else entirely?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan both work through their difficult relationships with their parents and find a way to help them move into a new home.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Dive into the Midwest's fried delights. From Friday night fish fries to tasty testicles and fried grilled cheese? Enjoy the area's most iconic and delectable crispy fried goodness.

programme.title: FIXT: Veteran Faces Terrifying Decision
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet some of New England's greatest hockey players, from NHL pros to high school's rising stars, and get to know them off the ice.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Crypto Crash
programme.desc: What was behind the collapse of crypto giant FTX? And what does it say about digital currencies, celebrity endorsements, and the collision of tech and finance?

programme.title: Stranded At The Border
programme.desc: In Real Life shows the reality at the U.S.-Mexico border, where people are living in dangerously poor conditions while seeking asylum.

programme.title: The Slavemaster
programme.desc: A father, husband and businessman by day transforms into a sadomasochistic by night. This veteran con-man lures unsuspecting women with a web of lies and empty promises only to trap them in a world of sex slavery and murder.

programme.title: An Opportunity To Kill
programme.desc: A wayward ex-marine drifts through central Oregon, off everyone's radar. He's homeless and forgotten about, committing petty crimes here and there, until one day he spots Amyjane and gets the urge to kill.

programme.title: A Treacherous Triangle
programme.desc: Two prominent doctors, two towns apart, are entangled in a passionate rivalry for the same woman's affections. When one loses, he exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a friend to take out the opposition.

programme.title: Doctor Death
programme.desc: For more than a decade, a genius doctor with a homicidal hobby gets away with murder at hospitals across two continents. Cops race against incredible odds to track him down just before he takes his next job and kills…again.

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Fit To Kill
programme.desc: A beautiful brunette is killed and left inside a burned out luxury car in the high desert. At first, it seems as though the perpetrators have gotten away with murder. As cops investigate the brutal homicide, they find a trail of missteps, which they trace back to two muscle-bound, married murderers.

programme.title: Redneck Retribution
programme.desc: A scorned mistress exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a group of derelicts to kill the wife of her lover. When the heat comes, she plays the victim and denies any involvement, but no level of acting will allow her to escape the cold truth, the murder was caught on camera.

programme.title: Seduced To Death
programme.desc: An evil seductress targets two Georgia police, bleeding them dry, then killing them for their life insurance benefits. This black widow gets away with murder for years before law enforcement untangles her web of seduction and lies and brings her to justice.

programme.title: Operation Pisces: Money Laundering For The Medellin Cartel
programme.desc: DEA Agent JD Miller is laundering money for the Medellin cartel. He needs help with the sheer volume of cash pickups so he brings in veteran undercover operative Louis Diaz to manage the West Coast operations. Together, JD and Louis run a scheme that also funds the DEA's evidence building efforts against Colombian kingpin, Jose Lopez. When they have enough recorded conversations and seized evidence against the kingpin, they take down Lopez and unearth his sprawling criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Operation Wake Up Cafe: Illegal Betting In Jersey
programme.desc: Passaic County, New Jersey officer Julia Torres goes undercover to bust an illegal betting club entrenched in the Little Italy neighborhood. As a woman running the operation dominated by male wise guys, it's a constant juggling act to collect evidence while not being made as a cop. Along the way, Torres life-saving efforts on a small boy nearly expose her and the operation. She manages to record conversations and bring down the backroom gambling operation to the delight of neighbors who applaud her efforts.

programme.title: Operation Dead Ringer: Busting Escobar's Cartel
programme.desc: Bill Gately and the U.S. Customs Service discover the owner of a coin laundry is laundering large sums of cash through a bank that originates from Columbia. Gately learns that one of the sources of the cash is none other than Pablo Escobar. Gately goes undercover and uses the man as a Trojan Horse to purchase one ton of cocaine, and follows the drugs to its destination. Along the way, the FBI bullies into the operation and loses the coke. Gately pulls out the stops to save his case and arrest those involved.
